movesets.name: SmashPass
movesets.description:
Moves

Shell Smash and Baton Pass allow Gorebyss's teammates to sweep easily if the combination is pulled off correctly. Hydro Pump is used in the third slot for a STAB attack if Gorebyss needs to use it. Surf can also be used for its better accuracy, though it's significantly weaker. Substitute helps Gorebyss more easily pass Shell Smash boosts by avoiding things like status, while also having the chance of being able to potentially pass a Substitute to a recipient. Ice Beam is another option for its good coverage alongside Hydro Pump, hitting the Grass- and Dragon-types that resist Water-type attacks.

Set Details

The given EV spread with a Timid nature allows Gorebyss to outspeed Pokemon with base 130 Speed after a Shell Smash, while maximum HP investment is used to help improve overall bulk. The rest is put in Special Attack in case Gorebyss ever needs to attack. White Herb helps Gorebyss better take a hit before Baton Passing, while also making sure its teammates aren't receiving stat drops. Mental Herb, while not on the set, allows Gorebyss to negate Taunt and successfully pass boosts to its teammates. Swift Swim, while very situational, can help make Gorebyss even faster and more threatening against opposing rain teams.

Usage Tips

Make sure that Gorebyss is in an ideal situation before Shell Smashing, as powerful attacks, Taunt, phazing moves, and status can all stop it from being able to pass. It is important to keep in mind that most Choice Scarf users will outspeed Gorebyss, even after a Shell Smash, meaning that Gorebyss will have trouble passing if the opponent is using a Choice Scarfer. Make sure you're using Gorebyss for Baton Pass and not for sweeping, as it's severely outclassed as a sweeper. That being said, Gorebyss can sweep late-game if absolutely necessary.

Team Options

The best partners for Gorebyss are easily powerful attackers with good coverage and decent bulk that lack a good boosting move, such as Hydregon, Nidoking, Kyurem, and Infernape. If these Pokemon are not sufficient for whatever reason, other good recipients include Metagross, Jirachi, Alakazam, Exploud, Krookodile, Arcanine, and Entei. Recipients such as Mega Houndoom, Victini, and Chandelure are helpful for absorbing incoming Grass-types attacks for Gorebyss, while the aforementioned Hydreigon, Nidoking, and Kyurem, in addition to Shaymin and Roserade, are helpful for taking on the Electric-types Gorebyss attracts. Roserade can also set up Spikes, which can assist in sweeps.

Other Options

Focus Sash is an option to guarantee Gorebyss can survive a hit, though White Herb is better for not passing Defensive and Special Defense drops. Hidden Power Grass can be used for bulky Water-types, though it misses out on valuable coverage against Dragon- and Grass-types if it is used over Ice Beam. Scald can be used instead of Hydro Pump, but it's weaker, and Gorebyss wants all the power it can get. An offensive Shell Smash set is possible, though it is outclassed by other Shell Smashers such as Cloyster and Omastar. Finally, a Baton Pass set utilizing Agility, Amnesia, or Barrier can be used, though it's almost always better off Baton Passing Shell Smash boosts.

movesets.name: SmashPass
movesets.description:
Moves

Shell Smash drastically increases Gorebyss's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed at the expense of its Defense and Special Defense. These are the boosts that are passed to another Pokemon, as Baton Pass transfers Gorebyss's stat changes to an ally and switches them in. Surf is a powerful STAB move that allows Gorebyss to benefit from Shell Smash itself. Hydro Pump is a more powerful STAB move that can be used in place of Surf, though it has worse accuracy. Substitute allows Gorebyss to avoid status, and it can even possibly pass a Substitute to another Pokemon. Ice Beam can be used to deal with Grass- and Flying-type Pokemon.

Set Details

White Herb removes the Defense and Special Defense drop caused by Shell Smash. Maximizing HP increases survivability, while maximizing Speed lets Gorebyss outspeed most of the tier after a Shell Smash, most notably Dragon Dance Tyranitar and Mega Manectric. A Calm nature is used to increase Gorebyss's Special Defense, as it has trouble surviving special attacks. Swift Swim allows Gorebyss to outspeed most Choice Scarf users at +2 if it's raining. Hydration allows Gorebyss to recover from status, again, in the event that it's raining. Generally, Swift Swim is the preferable option, as being able to beat some rain teams is really helpful, although it is somewhat niche.

Usage Tips

Use Shell Smash to increase Gorebyss's offensive ability, then use Baton Pass. This will transfer those incredible boosts to another Pokemon, preferably to a sweeper of some sort. Substitute should be used if you suspect that the opponent is going to use a status move. A Thunder Wave, Spore, or Dark Void can turn a good situation into a dangerous situation quickly, but having your opponent waste a turn destroying Gorebyss's Substitute can turn the situation back in your favor. Don't set up if it gives the opponent a chance to set up as well unless you know that Gorebyss can defeat the opposing Pokemon by itself. It can be very difficult to pull off a second SmashPass later in the game, as White Herb will have been consumed and Gorebyss will likely be at lower health. Gorebyss alone as a sweeper is too slow, weak, and outclassed. However, if the need arises, Gorebyss can be used late-game to clean up or rack up a few more KOs. White Herb will be consumed if any of Gorebyss's stats are lowered, so avoid things like Sticky Web and Defog in order to keep its White Herb intact.

Team Options

As Gorebyss is completely devoted to supporting its team through SmashPassing, the Pokemon that are on its team are almost as important, if not more important than itself. Pokemon such as Dragonite and Kyurem-B that are too slow or too weak to outright sweep that could use a little boost really benefit from Shell Smash being passed to them. Espeon is especially notable, as it can receive a SmashPass from Gorebyss and not be Roared out or crippled with status thanks to Magic Bounce. Specifically, Pokemon that can absorb Electric- and Grass-type attacks on the switch that would benefit from the boosts are good partners for Gorebyss. Charizard takes Grass-type attacks really well, and its sweeping potential is exponentially bolstered by a Shell Smash boost. Landorus and Garchomp are immune to Electric-type attacks and both of them do very well with a Shell Smash boost. Unaware users, specifically Quagsire and Clefable, make the entire Shell Smash + Baton Pass combination useless. A Grass-type attack from a Pokemon like Venusaur can deal with Quagsire, while a Steel-type attack from a Pokemon such as Bisharp makes short work of Clefable. Incidentally, all of these Pokemon greatly benefit from a SmashPass. The final notable bit is dual screens support from the likes of Azelf, which makes it much easier for Gorebyss to pull off a pass.

moves.name: Agility
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Amnesia
moves.description: Boosts Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Aqua Ring
moves.description: User recovers 1/16th of max HP each turn.

moves.name: Aqua Tail
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Barrier
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Baton Pass
moves.description: User switches, but passes on all stat changes and some special conditions.

moves.name: Bind
moves.description: Prevents the opponent from attacking for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Bounce
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn. 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brine
moves.description: Base Power doubles if foe's HP is 50% or less.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Clamp
moves.description: Prevents the opponent from attacking for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confuse Ray
moves.description: Confuses the target.

moves.name: Confusion
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Dive
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Hail
moves.description: Summons hail for 5 turns.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hydro Pump
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Ice Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Icy Wind
moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Infestation
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.

moves.name: Iron Defense
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mud Sport
moves.description: Electric-type attacks do 50% damage.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Muddy Water
moves.description: 30% chance to lower accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense 1 stage.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Refresh
moves.description: Removes status.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Safeguard
moves.description: Blocks status conditions for 5 turns.

moves.name: Scald
moves.description: 30% chance to burn the target. Thaws the user.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shell Smash
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 2 stages and lowers user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Supersonic
moves.description: Confuses the foe.

moves.name: Surf
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Water Gun
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Waterfall
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Whirlpool
moves.description: Traps and damages target for 4-5 turns.
